channel.title: Times of Grace
channel.description:
Does anyone remember the days of Killswitch Engage when Jesse was the singer? Well, he teamed up with Adam D., and they started a duo-type band, and they are pretty good (in my opinion..I also like KSE under Jesse more than under Howard). http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q59jzir_BLw Just one of their songs.
Thought, comments, anything

item.title: Times of Grace
item.dc:creator: @iCreatedHorror Ryan
item.description:
@iCreatedHorror wrote:

As I said, all screaming sucks. But I can deal with a nice mix of screaming and singing (KSE, ToG).

Read full topic

Also, no metal really gives me a headache unless the song is all screaming, hate that.

item.title: Times of Grace
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Radeon, post:10, topic:385018”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=480788.msg3520239#msg3520239 date=1299355938]

I had forgotten to finish my sentence, lol. And again, thanks for the reply.
And I have tried other genres, but this is the only one that I actually enjoy listening to. In a way, helps me get through everyday.
[/quote]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ur3pVBpX_Xc

Same kind of bluesy southern rock guitar there, except it goes a bit heavier. I have a billion bands around that same genre if you’re interesting in exploring what you like/dislike.

I quite liked that. Post similar stuff please.

Final some metal that doesn’t give you a headache.

Also what do you think of this? http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FPyBCDeFCck[/quote]Dream Evil r gr8. I been in their studio a couple of times ol

Read full topic

item.title: Times of Grace
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“iCreatedHorror, post:3, topic:385018”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=480788.msg3520226#msg3520226 date=1299355341]

anything
[/quote]Shit just like all metalcore. NEXT

At least someone commented, lol.
This happens to be the only genre I can listen to, as I think rap sucks. But this is better than a lot of the metalcore out there, imo. Thanks for the response Speljohan.[/quote]There’s a billion genres beside rap and metalcore…

EDIT: I saw KSE and expected metalcore, but then i checked and realized it wasn’t. Nevertheless, statement said in this post still stands!

EDIT2: Might add that the guitar is enjoyable, but i find the vocals horrid (too much pop)
